events.name: Data In Power - Virtual Event
events.description: ‚ÄãData and the distribution of decision-making power is an increasingly important dynamic to understand and engage with in climate and energy. Who is collecting, analyzing, and presenting data - how and why? These are the hard-hitting questions we will unpack in an open format discussion. If you have been looking for a space to share and engage with multiple perspectives through concrete examples of data‚Äôs influence within climate and energy decision-making, this event is for you!‚Äã*Note: This is a small group discussion so that we can dive deep into Data In Power principles and examples while building relationships. If you are interested, please RSVP even if the event is full, so that I can plan more for the calendar.

events.name: Dating App Disconnect: How to Actually Meet People IRL
events.description: ‚ÄãSo, how do Iactuallymeet someone out in the world?When you are trying to move from apps to dating in real life, fears, questions, awkwardness, and insecurities can come up. This event is all about diving into the tactical of going from swiping to IRL.‚ÄãBuild skills and confidence, while also connecting with others dating in NYC!‚ÄãHow?‚ÄãüîπIRL Dating Panel Discussion‚Äì Hear from IRL dating experts as they share insights on how to navigate real-life interactions. Featuring: Elle Wilson (founder of Met Through Friends), Brandon Dawkins of (founder of Beyond Nice), and Tawny Lara (author ofDry Humping: A Guide to Dating, Relating, and Hooking Up Without Booze).üîπInteractive Activities‚Äì Connect with people through guided activities exploring the fundamentals of IRL dating ‚Äî initiating conversation, navigating rejection, reading body language. Melissa Franks (founder of Embrace Club and professional certified cuddle therapist) will lead a light, fun exercise exploring consent.üîπMingling & Connection‚Äì Put your new skills and awareness into practice with informal mingling time. Meet a friend, a date, an acquaintance...see what happens!‚ÄãDating in NYC can feel lonely and frustrating. Let's rediscover the joy of meeting people in the real world, one connection at a time.‚ÄãAlcohol-free refreshments provided by Parentheses and Third Place Bar!‚ÄãWhat is The Full?‚ÄãThe Fullis a connection company that is addressing the loneliness epidemic through building community in dating. When founder Isabella Cassell was coaching people 1:1, she kept hearing the same things "I feel disconnected," "dating feels weird," and "this is a soul sucking experience." She realized so many felt alone in their dating experiences, although they were going through similar experiences. Through Dating App Disconnect, we are getting to the root of the issues with dating, helping people connect with themselves so they can better connect with others -- bringing joy, hope, and fun back to dating in NYC. Check out The Full onInstagram!‚ÄãWhat is Met Through Friends?Met Through Friendsstarted as a series of apartment parties for founder Elle Wilson‚Äôs real single friends. It began with the insight that she knew so many wonderful, ‚Äúdateable‚Äù people weren‚Äôt finding luck on the apps - what would happen if they and their friends got offline and into a room full of others looking for the same thing? Since 2022, it has grown to welcome thousands of friends from across NYC and beyond who are looking for more social, fun ways to connect.Elleis also a certified dating coach who works with individuals who are looking to build meaningful, productive, fun IRL dating lives. If you want more support to get ‚Äúun-stuck‚Äù fast, we‚Äôd love to work with you. Check outMet Through Friendson Instagram!‚ÄãWhat is(parentheses)?‚Äã(parentheses) is a fermented, artisanal spirit handmade in Brooklyn by a former sommelier and his wife who missed slow-sipping a stiff drink. ‚ÄãTawny Lara has reported on the sober curious and non-alcoholic beverage industry since 2015. She is the author ofDry Humping: A Guide to Dating, Relating, and Hooking Up Without the Boozeand co-author ofThe Sobriety Deck. She also co-hosts theRecovery Rocks podcast. She teachesvirtual coursesabout writing, publishing, media strategy, and DIY PR. Check out(parentheses)andTawny Laraon Instagram!‚ÄãWhat is Beyond Nice?Beyond Nicewas created by founder Brandon Dawkins, to remind men that they don't have to stop being nice to start being loved. Brandon works with men both 1:1 and through his event series "The Confidence Code" helping men move past the 'nice guy' label and step into confidence in their relationships and social life. Check outBeyond Niceon Instagram!‚ÄãWhat is Embrace Club?The Embrace Clubis a digital marketplace and community that offers a broad range of well-being, platonic, and holistic services. The founder, Melissa Franks, is a professional certified cuddle therapist, offering NYC's first and only cuddle studio. Her work is driven by a belief in nurturing the whole self. Check outEmbrace Clubon Instagram!‚Äã‚Äã‚ÄãWhat is Third Place Bar?Third Place Bar NYCis a series of alcohol-free pop-up bar events in New York City founded by Sam Bail in late 2022. The goal of Third Place Bar is to provide an environment for people to socialize and connect without feeling the pressure to drink - whether they‚Äôre just not drinking for the night, taking some time off, or are on a longer alcohol-free journey.‚ÄãWhat is Fabrik?Fabrikis on a mission to uplift communities and foster serendipitous connections in real life. Fabrik is a home for communities where everyone has a place to belong. With spaces designed to feel more like your living room than your office, Fabrik‚Äôs third spaces are vibrant hubs where people can come together in real life, explore interests, forge meaningful connections, and build a sense of community. Check outFabrikon Instagram!‚ÄãPlease note:‚Äã‚ÄãWe use RSVPs to plan for the number of attendees and ticket pricing to cover our costs in hosting.Unfortunately, we cannot grant refunds,but you are welcome to pass your ticket on to someone else.‚ÄãEmails will be collected and photos will be taken during the event for promotional purposes.By attending, you consent to your email being used for future promotions and image being used in future marketing materials. If you have any concerns or do not want your photo taken, please let us know.

events.name: Third Place Bar x Shanti House Mindful Friday Night Social
events.description: ‚ÄãThird Place Bar & Shanti Houseinvite to you a different kind of Friday night out. Join us at the Fabrik loft for a relaxing beginner's yoga class, a tea bar, non-alcoholic drinks, live DJ, and playful activities to wind down and de-stress from the week... without the hangover.‚ÄãWhat to expect:‚Äã6.30pm-7pm: Arrivals & mingling(please make sure to arrive on time before the yoga session!)‚Äã7pm-7.45pm: Unwind yin yoga led by Louisa, founder ofShanti House‚Äã7.45pm-9:00pm: Social hour with NA drinks‚ÄãStop by the tea bar byNoah Wellness, enjoy some light bites fromHappy Boards, and functional non-alcoholic drinks fromGuinep!‚ÄãDJ Solunawill be mixing all night! Whether it‚Äôs ambient soundscapes, soulful grooves, or energetic afrohouse beats, Soluna crafts immersive musical journeys that move both body and soul.‚ÄãFAQ‚Äã‚ÄãQ: Do I need to be there at the exact start time?Yes, please aim to arrive at 6.30pm as we will get started with the yoga class at 7pm and latecomers may not be admitted!‚Äã‚Äã‚ÄãQ: Can I come alone?Yes, this is a social mixer, you‚Äôre welcome to come alone and meet new people!‚Äã‚Äã‚ÄãQ: Is this an alcohol-free venue?Yes, Fabrik is a community space that does not serve alcohol.‚Äã‚Äã‚ÄãQ: Is there an age restriction?Yes, all our events are 21+‚ÄãQ: I've never done yoga, can I still come?The yoga class will be relaxed and suitable for beginners.‚ÄãQ: Do I need to bring a mat? Can I change somewhere?Yoga mat rental is included in the ticket price, but you're welcome to bring your own! There are limited changing rooms available.‚ÄãQ: I need to cancel, can I get a refund for my ticket?Unfortunately, we cannot offer refunds, but you're welcome to pass on your ticket to someone else.‚Äã‚Äã‚ÄãPlease note: By signing up for this event you agree to receive email communication from us. You can opt out any time.

events.name: GenZtea x Boss Me In: Gen Z Founder Match at Chief
events.description: ‚ÄãJoin a handpicked cohort of visionary Gen Z female founders for an intimate evening with members of Chief - the most exclusive private network for women executives at the VP and C-suite level, whose members lead organizations valued at over $800 billion collectively.‚ÄãAbout the Event:‚ÄãIn Chief's prestigious Manhattan clubhouse, where membership is by invitation-only and has a waitlist of thousands, 20 carefully selected Gen Z female founders will have the opportunity to connect one-on-one with some of business's most influential women leaders. This meticulously curated evening brings together today's Fortune 500 executives with tomorrow's groundbreaking entrepreneurs.‚ÄãWho Will Be There:‚Äã- 20 Selected Gen Z Female Founders‚Äã- 20 Chief Members (Women executives from Director to C-suite level at Fortune 500 companies, fastest-growing startups, and globally recognized brands)‚ÄãAbout the Hosts:‚ÄãChief is the most coveted private membership network for senior women executives, with an acceptance rate lower than Harvard. Members include executives from companies like Google, Nike, Goldman Sachs, and other industry-defining organizations. Chief's highly vetted community represents the upper echelon of business leadership, with membership limited to executives at the highest levels of organizational influence.‚ÄãBoss Me In is pioneering the future of intergenerational leadership, bridging the expertise gap between seasoned executives and emerging leaders through carefully curated connections and transformative experiences.‚ÄãGenZtea, spanning 21 countries, represents the elite network of Gen Z founders, creators, and investors shaping tomorrow's business landscape. Their partnerships with prestigious institutions and luxury brands like Pace University and Kiehl's showcase their commitment to elevating the next generation of business leaders.‚ÄãThis is a once-in-a-career opportunity to join an evening of unparalleled access and connection.‚Äã[Apply Now - Limited to 20 Gen Z Founders]‚ÄãLocation: Chief's Private Members' Club, NYC‚ÄãDue to the highly exclusive nature of this event, applications will undergo a rigorous review process. Selected participants will represent the most promising ventures and innovative thinking in their respective industries.

events.name: aci-d trip : The Lubalin Archives
events.description: ‚ÄãUpdate:We‚Äôre sold out! We‚Äôll likely do a second tour in April or May. Follow ourInstagramor subscribe to our luma calendar to hear about the announcement!‚Äã‚Äî‚Äî‚ÄãJoin us for a visit to the Lubalin Archives at The Cooper Union.The Lubalin Center preserves the work of Herb Lubalin and other designers through an archive that includes drawings, type specimens, posters, logos, and advertising materials. Lubalin is a goated American Graphic Designer and this growing archive contain works not only by him but also Paul Rand, Milton Glaser, Massimo Vignelli, and many others.‚ÄãThe archive isn‚Äôt digitized so you literally won‚Äôt be able to find its stuff on are.na, Pinterest, google images etc. We‚Äôre moving beyond aesthetics and engaging with materiality and context, folks! As someone who has visited the archives, I‚Äôd say it contains some of the best design references in the country.‚ÄãWe‚Äôre getting a hands-on presentation of a selection of material which lasts about an hour and a half. It's a closer look at some of the objects in the collection, the stories behind them, and what they can teach us about making work today. The emphasis is on ways we can make active use of design history as contemporary practitioners. The curators will use physical examples from the collection to construct specific case studies of ways we can look at objects to inform today's design decisions.‚ÄãThe Center usually doesn‚Äôt host groups past 3 PM, but they‚Äôve graciously agreed to keep the archive open for us until 6 PM on Friday, allowing for a 4 PM start. You may need to leave work a little early, but it‚Äôs a Friday and well worth it.

events.name: I Remember: Using Public Space to Construct Narrative
events.description:
This six-week generative writing workshop explores the interplay between our physical surroundings and inner world. Through direct engagement with public environments, we will observe how walking, loitering, shopping, and commuting can inspire writing. How do these everyday movements shape perception, memory, and narrative?
Observations and experience will become the foundation for new writing, unfolding into meditative episodes, digressive accounts, and stream-of-consciousness vignettes that capture lived experience and the movement of thought.
Each session will unfold in three parts: moving through public spaces to observe and gather material, a focused writing period with prompts, and opportunities to share work for those who wish.
This class is open to writers and artists of any level interested in deepening their engagement with space, perception, and writing.
Short, optional assigned readings will serve as inspiration, featuring authors such as Nicholson Baker, Teju Cole, Willa Cather, Virginia Woolf, and W.G. Sebald, among others.
By the end of the course, students will leave with a body of new writing, fresh observational tools, and a renewed awareness of how movement shapes creative practice.
